H0.text: Polyploid is an individual with more than the correct number of chromosome sets.

H1.text: Autotrophs are individuals with more than the correct number of chromosome sets.

H2.text: Autosome is an individual with more than the correct number of chromosome sets called.

H3.text: Diploid is the term used to refer to an individual who has more than the correct number of chromosome sets.

A4.text: Polyploidy is a condition in which the cells of an organism have more than two paired sets of (homologous) chromosomes.

A5.text: Diploid (two sets of chromosomes) refers to organisms that are normally diploid, with most eukaryotes being diploid.
